title.bibl: Otthon, Mar. 3, 1928. Eugene Boros at Kimball Hall.

div.bibl: Otthon, Mar. 3, 1928. EUGENE BOROS AT KIMBALL HALL.

body.p: p.2....The program offered by the American Conservatory of Music will include four immortal Hungarian compositions: Two works of Liszt, Hubay's "Hejre Kati" and Dohnanyi's newest composition.
This concert is an event in the lives of the Chicago Hungarians, because we will be represented by Eugene Doros, Jr., the son of Rev. Eugene Boros, who will play Liszt's "Eighth Rhapsody."
We call attention to this young artist, who, though very young, is the best Hungarian pianist in Chicago.
